data.prayer: Spirit, cause the 120 believers in Aerodrom to obey with immediate, radical, costly obedience, like Abraham.
data.verse: Then God said, “Take your son, your only son, whom you love — Isaac — and go to the region of Moriah. Sacrifice him there as a burnt offering on a mountain I will show you.” Early the next morning Abraham got up and loaded his donkey. He took with him two of his servants and his son Isaac. When he had cut enough wood for the burnt offering, he set out for the place God had told him about.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Aerodrom, North Macedonia
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: God in Heaven, only you can and should appoint evangelists. Please, appoint and send more to Aerodrom, North Macedonia.
data.verse: And in the church God has appointed first of all apostles, second prophets, third teachers, then workers of miracles, and those with gifts of healing, helping, administration, and various tongues.

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 600 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Spirit, please defend the 120 believers in Aerodrom against self-centered spirituality. Open their eyes to the fields ripe for harvest around them.
Jesus, strengthen the church in Aerodrom, North Macedonia by giving a prophet, as you said you would, who is bold and willing to correct. Lord, may the believers care about holiness as you do.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

data.prayer: Lord, you sent Jesus as a witness to testify about the light so that all the Albanian, Macedonian people might believe through him.
Father, please send teachers of your Word in Aerodrom who can speak your gospel boldly and clearly.
Father, thank you that in your kindness you have made every believer in Aerodrom, North Macedonia a priest, who can offer spiritual sacrifices to you through Jesus.
data.verse: Therefore I tell you that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people who will produce its fruit. He who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, but he on whom it falls will be crushed.”

data.section_summary:
the state of Aerodrom, North Macedonia has a population of 72,100.

We estimate Aerodrom has 120 people who might know Jesus, 44,562 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 27,418 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 600 neighbors who need Jesus.

data.prayer: Spirit, guide someone in the church in the state of Aerodrom to a person ready to receive the message of the gospel, like Lydia, and who will then open her home to faith.
data.verse: One of those listening was a woman from the city of Thyatira named Lydia, a dealer in purple cloth. She was a worshiper of God. The Lord opened her heart to respond to Paul’s message.
